trans-unit.source: Represents errors that occur when a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource"></xref> control parses values to create a query.
The ParseException object contains information about exceptions that occur when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control parses values in order to dynamically create a query.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource.Select%2A> property includes a property that is not in the data object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control raises a ParseException exception.
The message indicates that the property does not exist in the data object.

You can assign the data object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource.Selecting> event by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSourceSelectEventArgs.Result%2A> property to an object that is returned from a query.
If you select a property that does not exist in the data object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control raises a ParseException exception.
The message indicates that the particular property does not exist in an `AnonymousType` object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Query.Dynamic.ParseException"></xref> class.
The message that describes the error.
Gets the location of the error.
The location where the exception occurred.
Returns the error message and the location of the error.
The message and the position of the error.
